title: Drawing, Design for a Monument for Pope Pius VI, 1799
title_raw: Design for a Monument for Pope Pius VI
medium: Pen and brown ink; brush and brown wash over black chalk
markings: Watermark: escutcheon with A V; three (3) crescents
inscribed: Verso in graphite: F. Minozzi [early hand, not by the artist]
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: A platform, reached by a stair, supports a tall monument that has a blank tablet. Above, a vase-like sarcophagus with a portrait of the pope in a medallion, is surrounded by papal attributes: cross-staff, crozier, mitre and two angels. Lit candles in a candelabra rests on the floor.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for a Monument for Pope Pius VI, 1799. Pen and brown ink; brush and brown wash over black chalk. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1368
